node.title: The Earth is getting a black box recorder, and it's already starting listening
node.alt: A digital render showing a box in nature.
node.description: A giant steel box is about to begin recording everything we say and do about climate change, for the benefit of ours and future civilisations.
node.content:
["On a granite-strewn\u00a0plain, surrounded by gnarled mountains, sits a giant steel box.", "Incongruous\u00a0in the\u00a0landscape, much like Kubrick's black monolith of 2001: A Space Odyssey fame, its alien presence suggests it was put there with intent.", "And if those that discover it can decipher the messages it\u00a0contains, they could get a glimpse of what\u00a0caused the fall of the civilisation that was there\u00a0before.", "This is Earth's Black Box.", "
'First and foremost, it's a tool'
", "When an aeroplane crashes, it's left to investigators to sift through the wreckage to recover the black box.", "It's hoped the recorded contents can be used to help others avoid the same fate.", "And so it is\u00a0with Earth's Black Box: a 10-metre-by-4-metre-by-3-metre steel monolith\u00a0that's about to be built on a remote outcrop\u00a0on\u00a0Tasmania's west coast.", "Chosen for its geopolitical and geological stability, ahead of other candidates like Malta, Norway and Qatar,\u00a0the\u00a0idea is that the Tasmanian site can cradle the black box for the benefit of a future civilisation, should catastrophic climate change cause the downfall of ours.", "If that\u00a0sounds unhinged, it's worth remembering that we're currently on track for as much as 2.7C of warming this century.", "Ask any climate scientist what happens when warming breaches\u00a02C, and they'll almost invariably tell you it's not worth thinking about.", "Plenty of past civilisations and empires have collapsed in the face of less.", "So what is this black box? Artistic installation?\u00a0Academic experiment?\u00a0Or something else?", "The project is\u00a0completely non-commercial, and the\u00a0guiding\u00a0design principle is functionality, according to Jim Curtis from Clemenger BBDO.", "\"Obviously it's really a powerful concept when you say to someone, 'Earth's got a black box'. Because they're like, 'Why does it need a black box?'\" said Mr\u00a0Curtis, who's collaborating on the project with University of Tasmania researchers, among others.", "\"But first and foremost, it's a tool.\"", "
It's designed to record our actions
", "The box will be made\u00a0from 7.5-centimetre-thick\u00a0steel, cantilevered off granite, according to Jonathan Kneebone, co-founder\u00a0of artistic collective the Glue Society, which is also involved.", "\"It's built to outlive us all,\" he said.", "The box will be filled with a mass of storage drives\u00a0and have internet connectivity, all powered by solar panels on the structure's roof.", "Batteries will provide backup power storage.", "When the sun is shining, the black box will be downloading scientific data and an algorithm will be gleaning\u00a0climate-change-related material from the internet.\u00a0", "", "
The box will be made from 7.5-centimetre-thick steel.\u00a0(Supplied: earthsblackbox)
", "Broadly, it will be collecting two types of data:", "\"The idea is if the Earth does crash as a result of climate change,\u00a0this indestructible recording device will be there for whoever's left\u00a0to learn from that,\" Mr Curtis says.", "
Recordings have already started
", "The black box will record\u00a0backwards, as well as forwards in time, to document\u00a0how we got to where we are \u2014 pulling any available historical climate change data off the internet.", "And although\u00a0construction of the housing structure itself will only begin mid next year, the hard drives have already begun recording, beginning with the COP26 climate conference in Glasgow in November this year.", "Using compression and archiving, the developers estimate\u00a0there will be enough capacity to store\u00a0data for the next 30 to 50 years.", "In the meantime, they're investigating ways to expand that capacity, and more long-term storage methods including inscribing to \"steel plates\".", "\"This will enable us to be far more efficient with how each tier of storage is used and make it possible to store data for hundreds, if not thousands of years,\" they said.", "
The worst has happened. Now what?
", "So let's say we go the full Mad Max; climate change causes\u00a0crops to fail year on year;\u00a0ocean food-webs collapse;\u00a0it becomes impossible to feed eight, nine, 10(?) billion people; hundreds of millions are displaced by rising seas;\u00a0economies shrink\u00a0and society as we know it goes over the falls.", "Those who have discovered the black box \u2014\u00a0now the colour of rust, its solar panels long since dead \u2014\u00a0have\u00a0got no frame of reference for what they find inside or how to decipher it.", "So now what?", "\"That is a [question] that we are still working on ourselves,\" the developers say.", "\"But it can be assumed that it will not be of any use unless it is discovered by someone or something ... with the capability of understanding and interpreting basic symbolism.\"", "Gaining access to the box's interior through its three-inch-thick steel casing will already require some ingenuity.", "The developers presume whoever is capable of that will also be able to interpret basic symbols.", "\"Like the Rosetta Stone, we would look to use multiple formats of encoding,\" they said.", "\"We are exploring the possibility of including an electronic reader that stays within the box and will be activated upon exposure to sunlight, also reactivating the box if it has entered a long-term dormant state as a result of catastrophe.\"", "
I'm impatient for the apocalypse, what good is it to me now?
", "", "
People will be able to access the data and visit the site.(Supplied: earthsblackbox)
", "Once the black box is up and running,\u00a0the growing data bank will be accessible via a digital platform, and the plan is that people will also be able to connect wirelessly with it, if they're to visit the site.", "\"There are other features we are playing with such as transmitting summary stats in longer intervals into space, and having [a]\u00a0\"heartbeat\"\u00a0that communicates that the box is on and actively recording to on-site visitors,\" the developers\u00a0said.", "The location, between Strahan and Queenstown, is remote enough to offer some insulation\u00a0from sabotage, but accessible enough for those who want to see it.", "\"It takes a good four\u00a0hours from Hobart, [but]\u00a0it is something you'd be able to stop your car and go look at,\" Mr Kneebone said.", "And while it's intended as a blueprint for a post-apocalyptic society of what not to do,\u00a0it's also hoped that a complete recording of political and business leaders' actions on climate change might have an impact\u00a0right now.", "\"When people know they're being recorded, it does have an influence on what they do and\u00a0say,\" Mr Kneebone said.", "It's tempting to write this project off as an\u00a0indulgence in climate alarmism.", "But while most people don't get onto an aeroplane thinking it's going to crash, that's\u00a0not a reason to forgo a black box."]
